definition: to have an ulterior motive (idiom)
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: But he doesn't think the presence was something his subconscious conjured.
sentences.chinese: 但他不認爲他的存在是一些別有用心的潛意識。

sentences.english: To set the film in an abattoir is itself devious.
sentences.chinese: 把故事安排在屠場，是別有用心的。

sentences.english: Relevant report is totally groundless and out of ulterior motives.
sentences.chinese: 有關報道毫無根據，是別有用心的。

sentences.english: Not to give a child a Chinese name is a simple act that speaks volumes.
sentences.chinese: 少爲孩子取一個華文名，看似簡單，其實，別有用心。

definition: argument/view (sometimes derogatory)
to quote out of context (idiom)
to start a rumor
political position
rumor
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
to encourage/to foster/to foment
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
opposition faction
to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
